general_advisory: Farmers are advised to prepare nursery bed and treat the paddy seeds before sowing. Mulching vegetable seedlings is recommended to avoid cold injury. Light irrigation is advised for standing vegetables and crops due to prevailing low temperature.

advisory: Basal Fertilizer Application: Apply DAP, MOP, and Urea during last puddling. Zinc supplementation recommended for deficient soil. Transplant seedlings at proper spacing.
White grab infestation control: Use Chloropyriphous or Imidacloprid to minimize infestation.
Stem rot control: Drench the soil with Validamycin or Captan + Hexaconazole to control stem rot.
Planting stage: Apply DAP, MOP, and FYM at planting. Top dressing with Urea at specific intervals. Avoid late Urea application to prevent delayed maturity.
Hairy caterpillar control: Spray flubendiamide to control infestation. Difenoconazole or carbendazim for leaf spot control.
Dimond Back Moth and Head Borer management: Collect and destroy caterpillars and eggs. Use Neem-based or chemical pesticides for pest management.
Red palm weevil infestation control: Apply carbendazim in stem holes. Clean and disinfect compost yard to control rhinoceros beetle.
Sigatoka leaf spot control: Spray carbendazim or chlorothalonil to control the leaf spot.
Preventive measures for EUS: Apply Cifax in pond water as prevention. Feed fishes oil cake bran mixture daily.
